N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2410.4 - Accrediting agency responsibilities

State Regulations
(a) An accrediting agency as defined in this

Chapter shall comply with all laws and regulations governing the award program. In addition, an accrediting agency shall provide to the corporation: (1)
all applications for renewal of
recognition submitted to the department and the departments decision on all
such applications; (2)
all notices, information, documentation, and the like provided to the secretary including, but not limited to, the notices and information described in
34 C.F.R. sections
602.26
and
602.27; and
(3)
any other information and
documentation requested by the corporation. (b) No award shall be made to an educational
institution for which its accrediting agency has failed to comply with the
requirements of this Chapter. In addition, the educational institution may be
subject to possible sanctions in accordance with Part 2404 of this
